Method Detail

setRecipient

public void setRecipient(AID r)
Defines the recipient of this agent

step

public void step()
Invoked to update the agent state. This method is really the heart of the agent state. It is responsible for reading mail and performing requested behaviors. Every agent state comprises a state machine that updates only when a particular message is received. This allows continuing the simulation even if one agent blocked. This method handle generic signals like INIT, RESET and KILL. ALl other signals only depend on the nature of the agent.

Indicates whether plan meets conditions or not

createMovePlan

protected Plan createMovePlan(java.lang.String target)
Create a plan asking to move Creates a sequence of actions leading to the target city specified in the params. This function only accepts moving to neighbourng cities.

Parameters:
target - the name of the city towards which we should go
Returns:
a new plan for the AgentProfile to use

createPickupPlan

protected Plan createPickupPlan(java.lang.Integer taskID)
Create a pickup plan Creates a sequence of actions consisting in pickup up current task and going to the delivery city and deliver the task.

Parameters:
target -
Returns:
a new plan for the AgentProfile to use

notifyTaskBatchCreation

public abstract void notifyTaskBatchCreation()
This method notify agents that a new task batch was created

isAlive

public boolean isAlive()
Indicates whether agent is alive or not This method indicates whether an agent is still alive or not. Agents are not alive anymore when they are asked to kill themselves.

execute

protected abstract void execute(Action<?> action)
Executes some inner behavior This method allows executing behaviors that are not common to the different sorts of agents. This is particularly the case if the agent is in states different from kill, init or reset...

Parameters:
action - The current action generated in this state

notifySignal

public abstract void notifySignal(Signal<?> signal)
Notify an agent that a signal was send towards corresponding entity This method notifies the state of the agent that another agent sent a message towards the corresponding agent entity.

Parameters:
signal - The signal which was sent

setState

public void setState(AgentStateEnum as)
Set the current state of the agent Change the current state to the new one passed as a parameter. This is a sometimes desirable behavior to allow external objects to modify the current state of this class instance.

Parameters:
as - The new state

setRound

public void setRound(int round)
Define the current round This method indicates to agent states in which round they currently are in

Parameters:
round - the round number

notifyParent

protected void notifyParent(Action<?> action)
Notifies the parent when some action has been received by the child.

Parameters:
action - The action that parent should be notified

getNextAction

protected Action<?> getNextAction()
Get the next action available in associated message box Get the next action from the action list. This function discards all messages that are not actions. This prevents agents to do things they are not supposed to do.

Returns:
the action which was previously posted by an agent entity.

postInitSignal

public void postInitSignal(AgentProperties ap)
Post an initialization message to the recipient agent. This method invite the associated agent to initialize themselves.

Parameters:
ap - an object holding the attributes of the agent, like speed, cost-per-km, etc...

postResetSignal

public void postResetSignal(int round)
Post a reset message to the recipient agent. This method asks the agent to prepare itself for a round change. The round number is sent as a parameter.

Parameters:
round - the current round number

postKillSignal

public void postKillSignal(int reason)
Post a request for the agent to kill himself. This method sends a kill signal to recipient. A request to kill is sent at the end of the simulation or when an agent blocked.

Parameters:
reason - the reason which is invoked to kill the agent

postSetupSignal

public void postSetupSignal(java.lang.Object obj)
Post a request for the agent to set its state up. This method posts a signal to ask associated agent to set its state up. The object which is sent along with the message depends on the type of agent.

Parameters:
obj - the object sent to set agent up

postTaskRefusedSignal

public void postTaskRefusedSignal(int tid)
Informs the recipient agent that the task was refused.. This method informs the associated agent that the task it asked for is no longer available.

Parameters:
tid - the identifier of the refused task

postTaskDeliveredSignal

public void postTaskDeliveredSignal(int tid)
Informs the recipient agent that the task was delivered... This method informs the associated agent that the task was correctly delivered!

Parameters:
tid - a task identifier

postInCitySignal

public void postInCitySignal(InCityObject obj)
Method overloading for telling an agent it reached a city. This method sends an object which contains necessary data about a single city. The InCityObject contains the name of the city, the task(s) in current city as well as neighboring city names.

Parameters:
obj - an object holding the state of a city

postInStateSignal

public void postInStateSignal(InStateObject obj)
Method overloading for telling an agent it reached a city. This method informs the associated agent that the world is in a particular state. The InStateObject is a collection of InCityObject objects.

Parameters:
obj - an object holding the state of the world
